name: Mercury
description: Smallest planet in the solar system and closest to the Sun. Rocky surface full of craters, similar to our Moon. Very thin atmosphere.
fun_fact: A single Mercury day lasts almost 2 Mercury years!

name: Venus
description: Earth’s “sister planet” in size, but wrapped in a thick atmosphere of CO₂ with clouds of sulfuric acid. Hottest planet.
fun_fact: A Venus day is longer than its year, and the Sun rises in the west.

name: Earth
description: Our home planet, the only known world with liquid water, plate tectonics, and life.
fun_fact: About 70% of Earth is covered by water, but the oceans make up only 0.02% of Earth’s mass.

name: Mars
description: The Red Planet, famous for iron-rich dust, giant volcanoes (Olympus Mons), and deep valleys (Valles Marineris).
fun_fact: Mars has the largest volcano in the solar system, Olympus Mons, three times taller than Everest.

name: Jupiter
description: Largest planet, a gas giant with no solid surface. Famous for its Great Red Spot (a storm lasting centuries).
fun_fact: Jupiter is so massive it influences the orbits of other planets and has 79+ moons.

name: Saturn
description: Gas giant with the most spectacular ring system, made of billions of icy particles.
fun_fact: Saturn would float in water if a big enough bathtub existed.

name: Uranus
description: Ice giant with methane-rich atmosphere giving it a cyan color. Uniquely tilted at 98°, rolling on its side.
fun_fact: Each pole experiences 42 years of sunlight, then 42 years of darkness.

name: Neptune
description: Ice giant, deep blue due to methane, with extreme winds and storms. The farthest planet from the Sun.
fun_fact: Winds can reach 2,100 km/h, the fastest in the solar system.
